The Red Etin: by Andrew Lang
红色的埃廷: 作者：安德鲁·朗格

The Red Etin: There were ance twa widows that lived on a small bit o’ ground, which they rented from a farmer.
红色的埃廷: 从前，有两个寡妇，她们住在一小块从某个农场主那里租来的田地里。

The Red Etin: Ane of them had twa sons, and the other had ane; and by-and-by it was time for the wife that had twa sons to send them away to seeke their fortune.
红色的埃廷: 一个寡妇有两个儿子，而另一个寡妇只有一个；过了不久，到那位有两个儿子的寡妇送他们出门去寻找自己财富的时候了。

The Red Etin: So she told her eldest son ae day to take a can and bring her water from the well, that she might bake a cake for him; and however much or however little water he might bring, the cake would be great or sma’ accordingly; and that cake was to be a’ that she could gie him when he went on his travels.
红色的埃廷: 于是这天，她让大儿子拿一个罐子去井边打水，好让她为他做一块蛋糕；他打来水的多少，将相应地决定蛋糕的大小；而这个蛋糕是她在他上路时能够给他的全部东西。

The Red Etin: The lad gaed away wi’ the can to the well, and filled it wi’ water, and then came away hame again; but the can being broken the maist part of the water had run out before he got back.
红色的埃廷: 这位小伙子拿着罐子来到井边，把它灌满后带回了家；但罐子是漏的，在他到家之前水已经流走了一大半。

The Red Etin: So his cake was very sma’; yet sma’ as it was, his mother asked if he was willing to take the half of it with her blessing, telling him that, if he chose rather to have the hale, he would only get it wi’ her curse.
红色的埃廷: 因此他的蛋糕很小；尽管这块蛋糕小得可怜，他的母亲却问他愿不愿意只带走一半，并加上她的祝福，如果他执意要拿走整个蛋糕，将只能得到她的诅咒。

The Red Etin: The young man, thinking he might hae to travel a far way, and not knowing when or how he might get other provisions, said he would like to hae the hale cake, com of his mother’s malison what like; so she gave him the hale cake, and her malison alang wi’t.
红色的埃廷: 这位年轻人想到自己可能要走很长的路，不知何时以及怎样才能得到其他食物，于是他选择拿走整块带有他母亲诅咒的蛋糕；于是她就将带着自己诅咒的蛋糕给了他。

The Red Etin: Then he took his brither aside, and gave him a knife to keep till he should come back, desiring him to look at it every morning, and as lang as it continued to be clear, then he might be sure that the owner of it was well; but if it grew dim and rusty, then for certain some ill had befallen him.
红色的埃廷: 接着这位年轻人把他的弟弟叫到一边，给了他一把刀子，让他好好保存直到自己回来，并嘱咐他要每天早晨观察一下，只要刀子是干净明亮的，就说明自己是健康的；但是如果它变得生锈而暗淡了，那么他肯定就是出事了。

The Red Etin: So the young man set out to seek his fortune.
红色的埃廷: 于是这位年轻人就出发寻找自己的财富去了。

红色的埃廷: 另一家的寡妇和她的儿子从一位小精灵那里听说了这件事，于是这位年轻人决定要踏上自己的旅途，并试试看能否将他的两个朋友救出来。
